items.name: Magby

items.description: The Live Coal Pokémon. Magby's state of health is determined by observing the fire it breathes. If the Pokémon is spouting yellow flames from its mouth, it is in good health. When it is fatigued, black smoke will be mixed in with the flames.

abilities.name: Vital Spirit

abilities.name: Poison Heal
abilities.description: This Pokémon does not suffer the disadvantage effects of the poisoned status. In addition, this Pokémon recovers half of all poison damage it would take, including the damage at each of the end of its turns.

abilities.name: Technician
abilities.description: For damaging moves activated by this Pokémon with 15 max PP or more, they may roll the damage twice and choose either total.

items.name: Slakoth

evolution.description: Slakoth can evolve into Vigoroth at level 6 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 9 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

items.description: The Slacker Pokémon. Slakoth's heart beats just once a minute. Whatever happens, it is content to loaf around motionless. It is rare to see this Pokémon in motion.

abilities.name: Truant
abilities.description: This Pokémon cannot use the same move in back to back rounds.

items.name: Vigoroth

evolution.description: Vigoroth can evolve into Slaking at level 14 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 9 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

items.description: The Wild Monkey Pokémon. Vigoroth is always itching and agitated to go on a wild rampage. It simply can't tolerate sitting still for even a minute. This Pokémon's stress level rises if it can't be moving constantly.

abilities.name: Vital Spirit
abilities.description: This Pokémon cannot be put to sleep.

items.name: Slaking
items.description: The Lazy Pokémon. Slaking spends all day lying down and lolling about. It eats grass growing within its reach. If it eats all the grass it can reach, this Pokémon reluctantly moves to another spot.

abilities.name: Truant
abilities.description: This Pokémon cannot use the same move in back to back rounds.

items.name: Nincada

evolution.description: Nincada can evolve into Ninjask at level 6 and above. If its trainer has an empty Pokeslot and Pokeball (any kind), they also acquire a Shedinja at the same level. The Shedinja has all the base statistics that are in its stat block, plus any health and Ability Score Increases it would obtain from leveling up from its minimum found level. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 15 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

items.description: The Trainee Pokémon. Nincada lives underground for many years in complete darkness. This Pokémon absorbs nutrients from the roots of trees. It stays motionless as it waits for evolution.

abilities.name: Compound Eyes
abilities.description: This Pokémon gets an additional +1 to attack rolls.

abilities.name: Run Away
abilities.description: This Pokémon cannot be the target of an attack of opportunity.

items.name: Ninjask
items.description: The Ninja Pokémon. Ninjask moves around at such a high speed that it cannot be seen, even while its crying can be clearly heard. For that reason, this Pokémon was long believed to be invisible.

abilities.name: Speed Boost
abilities.description: This Pokémon's speed is increased by 10 feet while in an environment related to its type (DM Discretion).

abilities.name: Infiltrator
abilities.description: This Pokémon bypasses Light Screen, Reflect, Substitute, Mist, Safeguard, and Aurora Veil.

items.name: Shedinja
items.description: The Shed Pokémon. Shedinja's hard body doesn't move-not even a twitch. In fact, its body appears to be merely a hollow shell. It is believed that this Pokémon will steal the spirit of anyone peering into its hollow body from its back.
items.specialAbilityText: A Shedinja has both of its abilities, all the time.

abilities.name: Wonder Guard
abilities.description: This Pokémon is immune to damaging attacks from types that are not in its vulnerabilities list. (Shedinja only. Cannot be passed or swapped)

abilities.name: Paper Thin
abilities.description: This Pokémon always has a maximum HP of 1. (Shedinja only. Cannot be passed or swapped)

items.name: Whismur

evolution.description: Whismur can evolve into Loudred at level 6 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 10 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

items.description: The Whisper Pokémon. Normally, Whismur's voice is very quiet-it is barely audible even if one is paying close attention. However, if this Pokémon senses danger, it starts crying at an earsplitting volume.

abilities.name: Soundproof
abilities.description: This Pokémon is immune to sound-based moves.

abilities.name: Rattled
abilities.description: When this Pokémon is hit by a damaging Dark, Bug, or Ghost move, it makes its next attack at advantage.

items.name: Loudred

evolution.description: Loudred can evolve into Exploud at level 14 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 8 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

items.description: The Big Voice Pokémon. Loudred's bellowing can completely decimate a wood-frame house. It uses its voice to punish its foes. This Pokémon's round ears serve as loudspeakers.

abilities.name: Soundproof
abilities.description: This Pokémon is immune to sound-based moves.

abilities.name: Scrappy
abilities.description: This Pokémon's Normal and Fighting type moves ignore immunities granted by a Pokémon's type. If a target’s secondary type gives it vulnerability or resistance to the attack, it follows the secondary type for that effect.

items.name: Exploud
items.description: The Loud Noise Pokémon. Exploud triggers earthquakes with the tremors it creates by bellowing. If this Pokémon violently inhales from the ports on its body, it's a sign that it is preparing to let loose a huge bellow.

abilities.name: Soundproof
abilities.description: This Pokémon is immune to sound-based moves.

abilities.description: This Pokémon's Normal and Fighting type moves ignore immunities granted by a Pokémon's type. If a target’s secondary type gives it vulnerability or resistance to the attack, it follows the secondary type for that effect.

evolution.description: Makuhita can evolve into Hariyama at level 7 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 7 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

items.description: The Guts Pokémon. Makuhita is tenacious-it will keep getting up and attacking its foe however many times it is knocked down. Every time it gets back up, this Pokémon stores more energy in its body for evolving.

abilities.name: Thick Fat
abilities.description: This Pokemon takes half the damage it otherwise would from Ice and Fire damage.

abilities.name: Guts
abilities.description: When this Pokémon is burned or poisoned, they are not affected by the disadvantage or reduced damage effects. They still take damage at the end of each of their turns.

abilities.name: Sheer Force
abilities.description: When activating a move that has a chance to impose a stat change or inflict a status, this creature instead doubles its move modifier for the damage with no chance of the additional effect.

items.name: Hariyama
items.description: The Arm Thrust Pokémon. Hariyama practices its straight-arm slaps in any number of locations. One hit of this Pokémon's powerful, openhanded, straight-arm punches could snap a telephone pole in two.

abilities.name: Thick Fat

items.name: Azurill

evolution.description: Azurill can evolve into Marill at level 3 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 6 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

items.description: The Polka Dot Pokémon. Azurill spins its tail as if it were a lasso, then hurls it far. The momentum of the throw sends its body flying, too. Using this unique action, one of these Pokémon managed to hurl itself a record 33 feet.

abilities.name: Thick Fat

abilities.description: Once per short rest, this Pokémon may double the damage dice for a single damage roll. The player must announce that they are using this ability before the attack roll.

abilities.description: This Pokémon takes no damage from grass-type attacks. If hit by a grass type move, it takes no damage and instead absorbs the energy, granting advantage on its next attack.

items.name: Nosepass

evolution.description: Nosepass can evolve into Probopass at level 12 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 10 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

items.description: The Compass Pokémon. Nosepass's magnetic nose is always pointed to the north. If two of these Pokémon meet, they cannot turn their faces to each other when they are close because their magnetic noses repel one another.

abilities.name: Sturdy
abilities.description: When taking damage equal to half or more of your current HP, roll a d4. On a result of 3 of 4, halve the damage dealt.

abilities.description: Steel opponents in battle with this Pokémon may not switch out or flee.

abilities.name: Sand Force
abilities.description: During a Sandstorm, this Pokémon can double its STAB when it hits an opponent.

evolution.description: Skitty can evolve into Delcatty at level 8 and above with the help of a Moon Stone. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 9 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

items.description: The Kitten Pokémon. Skitty has the habit of becoming fascinated by moving objects and chasing them around. This Pokémon is known to chase after its own tail and become dizzy.

abilities.name: Cute Charm
abilities.description: Once per short rest, you can impose disadvantage on an enemy attack roll of your choice.

abilities.name: Normalize
abilities.description: Every move this Pokémon activates is Normal type.

abilities.name: Wonder Skin
abilities.description: This Pokémon has advantage on all saving throws against being burned, frozen, poisoned, or paralyzed.

items.name: Delcatty
items.description: The Prim Pokémon. Delcatty prefers to live an unfettered existence in which it can do as it pleases at its own pace. Because this Pokémon eats and sleeps whenever it decides, its daily routines are completely random.

abilities.description: Once per short rest, this Pokémon can move to the top of initiative order in a single round, but must use a status-affecting move on its turn.

items.name: Mawile
items.description: The Deceiver Pokémon. Mawile's huge jaws are actually steel horns that have been transformed. Its docile-looking face serves to lull its foe into letting down its guard. When the foe least expects it, Mawile chomps it with its gaping jaws.

items.description: The Iron Armor Pokémon. This Pokémon has a body of steel. To make its body, Aron feeds on iron ore that it digs from mountains. Occasionally, it causes major trouble by eating bridges and rails.

items.description: The Iron Armor Pokémon. Lairon tempers its steel body by drinking highly nutritious mineral springwater until it is bloated. This Pokémon makes its nest close to springs of delicious water.

items.description: The Meditate Pokémon. Meditite heightens its inner energy through meditation. It survives on just one berry a day. Minimal eating is another aspect of this Pokémon's training.

items.description: The Firefly Pokémon. Volbeat's tail glows like a lightbulb. With other Volbeat, it uses its tail to draw geometric shapes in the night sky. This Pokémon loves the sweet aroma given off by Illumise.

items.description: The Stomach Pokémon. Most of Gulpin's body is made up of its stomach-its heart and brain are very small in comparison. This Pokémon's stomach contains special enzymes that dissolve anything.

items.description: The Cotton Bird Pokémon. Swablu has light and fluffy wings that are like cottony clouds. This Pokémon is not frightened of people. It lands on the heads of people and sits there like a cotton-fluff hat.

abilities.name: Natural Cure
abilities.description: This Pokémon is cured of negative status ailments upon returning to its Pokeball.

abilities.name: Cloud Nine
abilities.description: While this Pokémon is in battle, weather-related abilities have no effect on the Pokémon that have them.

items.name: Altaria
items.description: The Humming Pokémon. Altaria sings in a gorgeous soprano. Its wings are like cotton clouds. This Pokémon catches updrafts with its buoyant wings and soars way up into the wild blue yonder.

abilities.name: Natural Cure
abilities.description: This Pokémon is cured of negative status ailments upon returning to its Pokeball.

abilities.name: Cloud Nine
abilities.description: While this Pokémon is in battle, weather-related abilities have no effect on the Pokémon that have them.

items.name: Zangoose

abilities.name: Immunity
abilities.description: This Pokémon is immune to becoming poisoned.

abilities.name: Toxic Boost
abilities.description: When this Pokémon is hit by a poison-type attack, its next attack is rolled at advantage.

items.name: Seviper

abilities.name: Shed Skin
abilities.description: If this Pokémon is affected by a negative status ailment, they can roll a d4 at the end of each of their turns. On a result of 4, they are cured.

abilities.name: Infiltrator

items.name: Lunatone
items.description: The Meteorite Pokémon. Lunatone was discovered at a location where a meteoroid fell. As a result, some people theorize that this Pokémon came from space. However, no one has been able to prove this theory so far.

abilities.name: Levitate
abilities.description: This Pokémon is immune to ground moves.

items.name: Solrock

abilities.name: Levitate

items.description: The Barnacle Pokémon. Cradily's body serves as an anchor, preventing it from being washed away in rough seas. This Pokémon secretes a strong digestive fluid from its tentacles.

abilities.name: Transformer
abilities.description: This Pokémon has a standard Normal form from which all stats are based, but may change forms as a bonus action to drastically change its abilities. The forms it can take are Attack, Defense, and Speed. In Attack form, it adds an additional +5 to its attack rolls, but all attacks against it has advantage. In Defense form, its AC increases by 3, but its attacks are rolled at disadvantage. If the activated move requires a save, the target(s) have advantage. In Speed form, it gains an additional attack action each turn, but the attack is done at disadvantage. If it is a move that requires a save, the target(s) have advantage.

If this would put the Pokémon in range of switching out, it must do so as another free action if another Pokémon is available to replace it.

items.name: Golisopod

When this Pokémon falls below 50% of its maximum hp, its outer shell breaks and it changes to Core Form. In Core Form, it adds 6 points to its DEX, but reduces its AC by 4. The Pokémon must complete a short rest to restore itself to Meteor Form.
